page.title: 20Road Verge Nature Reserves
page.content: There are 14 road verges in the County of Bedfordshire that have been designated as nature reserves, one of which is in Thurleigh. The designation is due to the presence of flowers that are scarce in the countryside. The reserves are managed to maintain their wildlife interest by the Community Programme team, YouthTraining Scheme and the Bedfordshire Conservation Volunteers. The reserve has many species of attractive and uncommon plantsincluding, tall broomrape, yellow rattle and bee orchids. This year the scrub was removed to ensure the continuous growth of these plants and the verges have been marked with new posts and signs so that people will know where they are.
